page.title: 15Rounders cont.
page.content: are inter-village teams. There are 9 players in a team- a bowler, a backstop, a person for each of the four bases and three deep fielders. The object of the game is for the team that is batting to score 'rounders' which entails hitting the ball as hard as possible so that the batter can run past four bases which are arranged in a sort of square. If the batsman misses the ball, the backstop throws the ball to the person standing at first base as quickly as possible before the batsman has chance to get there and touches the post which is at each base. The batsman is then out. If the batsman hits the ball and it is caught , he is also out. If any of the fielders touch the bases with the ball before the batsman manages to reach them, he is out. He may stop at any base he chooses if he thinks he
